result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek Scott Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derek Scott Patterson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Derek Scott Patterson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Derek Scott Patterson was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1 and 2.
Defendant to report to Probation no later thanThursday December 8, 2016 by 3:00 p.m.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle DF:  Derek Scott Patterson appeared from jail, pro se. Agent Kasondra Moll present. Case called at 11:17 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a probation review hearing. Court has reviewed the letter received by the Agent. Agent Moll states she requested someone from the DA's Office to be present. Clerk was told by their office there is no need for their appearance today. Agent Moll gives an update on the DE's progress on probation. DE states employed as a musician and volunteers. Does not have a good enough excuse for not completing the programming that was ordered. Agent Moll states DE did complete AODA and Domestic Violence Assessment. Court hands DE a paper with a must do list and pen. Given number to set up an anger and stress management assessment. Will call upon one day of release. Make $50 payments beginning July 1 towards court costs. Agent Moll states DE will need to apply for interstate compact again right away. DE has a meeting with MN probation officer on the 23rd. Will need to confirm appointment one day upon release.  Address updated in Court.
To RMW from Agent Moll re: Probation Review Hearing. To RMW for review. hml

CO: RMW, REP: Deiss, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Derek Scott Patterson appeared. Case called at 4:19 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a final pre trial. ADA McKinley states there is a resolution. Recites agreement. State has complied with Victims Rights.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct's 3 & 4 in 15CF424. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct's 3 & 4   in 15CF424. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct's 1 & 2 in 15CF424. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. 20 days to file appeal. Restitution to be determined within 30 days. If no resitution is requested, court will not enter an amount. 

Crt orders:

In Count 3 Disorderly Conduct:

- S/W 2 years probation. Report to probation no later than 3 p.m. Thursday December 8, 2016. Bond to remain until reports to probation.

- Court costs in the amount of $243.00. Bond to apply. Remainder of fines to be paid through probation.

- DNA Sample and $200.00 Surcharge

- Domestic abuse surcharge

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

 - Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections  

- Continue with AODA and follow through with recommended treatment

- Complete a domestic abuse assessment and follow through with all recommendations

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Caitlin Schifsky.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  

In Count 4 Criminal Damage to Property:

- S/W 2 years probation. Report to probation no later than 3 p.m. Thursday December 8, 2016. Bond to remain until reports to probation. Concurrent to Count 3.

- Court costs in the amount of $243.00. Bond to apply. Remainder of fines to be paid through probation.

- DNA Sample and $200.00 Surcharge

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

 - Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections  

- Continue with AODA and follow through with recommended treatment

- Complete a domestic abuse assessment and follow through with all recommendations

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Caitlin Schifsky.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.

Bond on file.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Katiln S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
